title: A Teenager's Confusing Police Experience
summary: Theo Rose, a teenager, told the police he was attacked at school. Instead of helping him, the police gave him a punishment called a community resolution for something he didn't do. Theo was confused and scared because he didn't understand what was happening. Later, an investigation found that the police made a mistake. They apologized to Theo and removed the punishment. This story shows how important it is for police to listen carefully and explain things clearly to young people.

background_read: Police are supposed to help people when they report crimes. Sometimes, they use community resolutions to solve problems without going to court. In this story, a teenager named Theo told the police he was attacked at school, but the police gave him a community resolution instead of helping him. This made Theo confused and scared. An investigation later found that the police made a mistake and apologized. This shows that police need to be careful and clear when talking to young people to avoid misunderstandings.
Article_Structure: WHO: Theo Rose, a teenager who reported an assault at school
WHAT: The police gave him a community resolution punishment instead of helping him, which was later found to be a mistake
WHERE: At a police station in Halesowen, part of West Midlands Police
WHY: To show how police mistakes can affect young people and the importance of clear communication

perspectives.description: He felt scared and confused when the police punished him for something he didn't do, and he worried about his future.
